conclusion: The frame is a square with side length l, the magnetic field has a width d, the frame moves with a constant speed v, and the condition is l < d.
An induced current occurs when the frame is partially or fully inside the magnetic field.
The frame will enter the magnetic field, move through it, and then exit.
The frame starts entering the magnetic field when its left edge reaches the left boundary of the magnetic field.
The frame will be fully inside the magnetic field when its right edge reaches the left boundary of the magnetic field, which happens when the frame has moved a distance l.
Time to enter the magnetic field: t_entry = l/v.
The frame starts exiting the magnetic field when its left edge reaches the right boundary of the magnetic field.
The frame will be fully out of the magnetic field when its right edge reaches the right boundary of the magnetic field, which happens when the frame has moved a distance d from the left boundary.
Time to exit the magnetic field: t_exit = d/v.
The total time during which the frame is partially or fully inside the magnetic field is the time from when the left edge enters until the right edge exits.
Total time: t_total = t_exit - t_entry = (d/v) - (l/v) = (d - l)/v.
The time during which there is an induced current in the frame is (d - l)/v.
